Detailed Description

Simple definition of the structure Uni with fonctions.

Author:
Julien Delavande
This is a definition of the structure Uni which represent a universe. It contains the size of the universe an a matrix filled with char to represent the universe.

The API of the naive_univer.h is defined as follows:

  • a function to get the value of the universe's matrix
  • a function to set the universe matrix's cells dead
  • a function to display the universe in the terminal
  • a function to switch the value in its other state of a cells in the universe matrix
  • a function to set a cell's universe matrix alive
  • a function to set a cell's universe matrix dead
  • a function to create a copy of a given universe
  • a fonction to desalocate the universe matrix

Function Documentation

char access ( Uni  universe,
int  ligne,
int  column 
)

Get the value of the universe's matrix.

Parameters:
universe the universe
ligne the ligne of the value you want to access
column the column of the value you want to access
Returns:
the character of the given ligne and column of the universe matrix
Precondition:
`ligne` and `column`should be comprised between 0 and universe.height-1 and universe.width-1 respectively

a copy of the universe

Desalocate the universe matrix.

the universe matrix is desalocated

void set_alive ( Uni *  p_universe,
int  ligne,
int  colomn 
)

Set a cell's universe matrix alive.

Parameters:
p_universe a pointer toward the universe to be modified
ligne the ligne of the value you want to modified
column the column of the value you want to modified
Postcondition:
After the call to `aff_uni`, the given cell of the universe matrix is set alive (the given cell contain the 'o' character)

void set_dead ( Uni *  p_universe,
int  ligne,
int  colomn 
)

Set a cell's universe matrix dead.

Parameters:
p_universe a pointer toward the universe to be modified
ligne the ligne of the value you want to modified
column the column of the value you want to modified
Postcondition:
After the call to `aff_uni`, the given cell of the universe matrix is set dead (the given cell contain the '.' character)

void set_universe_null ( Uni *  p_universe  ) 

Set the universe matrix's cells dead.

Parameters:
p_universe a pointer toward the universe to be modified
Postcondition:
After the call to `set_universe_null`, all cells of the universe matrix are set dead (contain the char '-')

void switch_value ( Uni *  p_universe,
int  ligne,
int  colomn 
)

Switch the value in its other state of a cells in the universe matrix.

Parameters:
p_universe a pointer toward the universe to be modified
ligne the ligne of the value you want to modified
column the column of the value you want to modified
Postcondition:
After the call to `aff_uni`, the given cell of the universe matrix switch its value into the other state
